com.jbion.utils.progress

Class AbstractProgressBar

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jbion.utils.progress.AbstractProgressBar
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    OneTimeProgressBar, ReDrawnProgressBar

    public abstract class AbstractProgressBar
extends Object
    A base class to build a console progress bar. The bar may be displayed via any PrintStream, using the standard output System.out by default.
    Author:
    Joffrey Bion

      Creates a new AbstractProgressBar.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractProgressBar

        public AbstractProgressBar(int total,
                   int length)
        Creates a new AbstractProgressBar.
        Parameters:
        total - The number of elements this AbstractProgressBar represents.
        length - The number of characters used to display this AbstractProgressBar when it is complete.

        Returns:
        the current PrintStream in use.

        Parameters:
        printStream - the PrintStream to use to print this bar

        public BarStyle getBarStyle()
        Returns:
        the current style of this progress bar.

        public void setBarStyle(BarStyle barStyle)

        public HeaderStyle getHeaderStyle()
        Returns:

      • setHeaderStyle

        public void setHeaderStyle(HeaderStyle headerStyle)
        Parameters:

      • begin

        public abstract void begin()
        Prints the beginning of this bar. Also prints this bar's header if any.

      • printProgress

        public void printProgress(int current)
        Prints the specified progress in this bar.
        Parameters:
        current - The number of elements counted as complete.

      • end

        public abstract void end()
        Prints the end of this bar.
